snippet: State legislators had not reached an agreement on the law, which currently covers nearly one million city dwellings.
abstract: New York State lawmakers fail to reach agreement with rent regulations in New York City and surrounding area set to expire; regulations cover some one million apartments in area; negotiations have snagged on a number of issues as Democrats seek extension that will slow speed at which rent-stabilized apartments are converted to market rates; Mayor Bill de Blasio has criticized dysfunction.

byline.contributor: John Leland, Noah Remnick and Colleen Wright contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: State legislators had not reached an agreement on the law, which currently covers nearly one million city dwellings.

headline.main: Rent Regulations on New York City Apartments Expire on Monday
headline.print_headline: Lawmakers at Impasse, Threatening Rent Control
